prompt_text:
You are a structured information extraction assistant. Read the following scientific abstract and extract the information into the exact JSON format below. Use only information explicitly stated in the abstract. If a field is not mentioned, use null.

Output format (JSON only, no explanation):
{
  "objective": "string — main goal of the study",
  "method": "string — methodology or approach used",
  "key_result": "string — most important quantitative or qualitative result",
  "model_or_system": "string — name of the model/system proposed (if any)",
  "benchmark": "string — evaluation benchmark or dataset used (if any)"
}
input_text: We propose a new framework for estimating generative models via an adversarial process, in which we simultaneously train two models: a generative model G that captures the data distribution, and a discriminative model D that estimates the probability that a sample came from the training data rather than G. The training procedure for G is to maximize the probability of D making a mistake. This framework corresponds to a minimax two-player game. In the space of arbitrary functions G and D, a unique solution exists, with G recovering the training data distribution and D equal to 1/2 everywhere. In the case where G and D are defined by multilayer perceptrons, the entire system can be trained with backpropagation. There is no need for any Markov chains or unrolled approximate inference networks during either training or generation of samples. Experiments demonstrate the potential of the framework through qualitative and quantitative evaluation of the generated samples.

environment.os_version: Darwin Kernel Version 24.6.0: Wed Nov  5 21:34:00 PST 2025; root:xnu-11417.140.69.705.2~1/RELEASE_ARM64_T8132

affiliation: UTFPR - Universidade Tecnologica Federal do Parana
output_text:
```json
{
  "objective": "To propose a new framework for estimating generative models via an adversarial process by simultaneously training a generative model G that captures data distribution and a discriminative model D that estimates the probability a sample came from training data",
  "method": "Adversarial training framework formulated as a minimax two-player game, with both G and D defined by multilayer perceptrons trained using backpropagation",
  "key_result": "A unique solution exists in the space of arbitrary functions where G recovers the training data distribution and D equals 1/2 everywhere; the system can be trained without Markov chains or unrolled approximate inference networks",
  "model_or_system": "Generative Adversarial Network (GAN) framework with generator G and discriminator D",
  "benchmark": "Qualitative and quantitative evaluation of generated samples (specific benchmarks or datasets not named in abstract)"
}
```
